entity.name: Countryfile

Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

urls.title: Landscapes to Lifescapes: How does flooding affect us? | The Flood Hub
urls.description: WELCOME to this collaborative project between Lancaster University, the University of Hull and the Environment Agency, exploring how flooding affects our physical and social environment – our ‘landscapes and lifescapes’. Landscapes to Lifescapes features many games and videos, including our exciting new 360 virtual reality experience, Help Callum. Enter the exhibition via the ‘virtual floorplan’ below. You can then follow the suggested route or come back to this floorplan to decide where you want to go

Never drive through flood water. 

It's the number one cause of death during floods and even relatively shallow water can move your car or wreck its engine.

urls.title: Calderdale NFM – Yorkshire Integrated Catchment Solutions Programme (iCASP)

tweets.text:
Follow @Calderdale tmrw to look back on #StormCiara & see how our partners are achieving greater resilience to #flooding.

One of our projects is helping communities understand  the impact of natural flood management #NFM on #flooding @EnvAgencyYNE 

https://t.co/BDkl48AjUO https://t.co/tQOHwuO3QA

On the 9th Feb 2020 #StormCiara caused devastation in Calderdale. Tomorrow, a year on, we'll be looking back at the impact of Storm Ciara, and celebrating the amazing community spirit that we witnessed. 

Follow our takeover as we look ahead at plans to build greater resilience💚 https://t.co/uz1qBuFsyX

I haven’t posted for a while, but great to see some of the attenuation areas holding water after all the rain! #nfm #slowtheflow #watermanagement #upstreamstorage @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @isbournecatch @GlosCC @TewkesburyBCgov https://t.co/2dyfAR5hMl

River levels across Lincolnshire remain very high, particularly on the Rivers #Witham and #Ancholme. 

We currently have 6 Flood Warnings and several Flood Alerts in place. 

See if you're affected and take action - https://t.co/aPgqDmb7Ql

#Lincolnshire #floodaware https://t.co/TdA0LMkKyJ

#FloodAware https://t.co/ObX36kA0GB

urls.title: Urban trees and forests in the spotlight as the UN Decade on Ecosystem Restoration commences | UNECE
urls.description: In light of unprecedented heatwaves and series of lockdowns that hit cities across Europe and North America over the last year, ensuring there are green urban spaces that could help bring down the temperature and provide safe spaces for recreation and relaxation has never been higher on policy-makers’ agendas. In March 2019, the United Nations General Assembly declared 2021 – 2030 to be the Decade on Ecosystem Restoration and called for action at all levels to protect and restore degraded ecosystems and
